title: Investment Scams
description: Scammers promise guaranteed or 'risk-free' returns to lure people into fraudulent investment opportunities through phone calls, emails, texts, or social media.
advice: Be cautious of unsolicited offers. Research thoroughly before investing. Verify companies through the SEC’s EDGAR database and monitor account statements regularly.

title: Tech Support Fraud
description: Fraudsters pose as legitimate tech companies to trick victims into providing personal information or granting remote access to their computers.
warningSigns: Claims of expired software or illegal content
advice: Install antivirus software, ignore pop-ups, and hang up on unsolicited tech support calls. Contact your device manufacturer directly if unsure.

title: Romance Scams
description: Scammers build fake romantic relationships online, often claiming to be overseas, and eventually ask for money to solve fake emergencies.
advice: Be cautious about sending money to anyone you haven’t met. Stay connected with family and consult a professional if a relationship feels suspicious.

title: Government Impersonation Scams
description: Criminals pretend to be from agencies like the IRS, Social Security, or Medicare, demanding payments or personal information.
warningSigns: Threats of arrest or benefit loss
Requests for payment via gift cards or wire transfers
advice: Hang up on suspicious calls and never share personal information. Regularly review your credit and Medicare statements for unusual activity.

title: Grandparent or Emergency Scams
description: Scammers call pretending to be a relative in distress, often a grandchild, and urgently request money while asking for secrecy.
warningSigns: Requests for secrecy or unusual payment methods
advice: Verify the caller’s identity before sending money. Contact the family directly to confirm the story and avoid sending wired funds or gift cards.

title: Sweepstakes and Lottery Scams
description: Victims are told they’ve won a big prize or lottery but must pay upfront taxes or fees to claim it. The prize never arrives.
warningSigns: Winning a contest you didn’t enter
Pressure to pay taxes or fees upfront
advice: Legitimate contests never require payment to claim a prize. Do not share personal or financial details with unsolicited contacts.

title: Telemarketing Phone Scams
description: Criminals use phone calls to sell fake products, collect donations, or pose as relatives in need. Seniors are often targeted due to higher phone engagement.
advice: Be skeptical of unknown callers. Use call screening tools, hang up on pressure tactics, and research companies or charities before paying.

title: Homeowner and Reverse Mortgage Scams
description: Scammers target homeowners with fake refinancing, foreclosure assistance, or reverse mortgage offers to steal equity or personal data.
advice: Never sign documents you don’t understand. Speak with a certified reverse mortgage counselor or financial advisor before committing.

title: Text or 'Smishing' Scams
description: Fraudulent texts claim unpaid tolls or undelivered packages to trick victims into clicking malicious links or sharing information.
losses: $129,624 lost to toll text scams in 2024 (FBI)
warningSigns: Texts from unknown numbers with links
advice: Never click suspicious links or reply to unknown texts. Contact organizations using verified phone numbers and enable spam filters on your device.

title: Obituary Scams
description: Scammers exploit grieving families by claiming the deceased owed money or by stealing the deceased’s identity using obituary details.
advice: Limit personal details in obituaries and never provide financial or personal data to unsolicited contacts.
